item.title: Report X-2023090321
item.description:
Report X-2023090321

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: COLUMBIA
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being unloaded by package handlers off of trailer. QA notified for leaking hazmat package. Package was then moved to hazmat cage for further processing. DescribePack: loose cap cause by mishandling of package making dents in the inner cylinders forcing a release. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Removal of package to hazmat cage. Tightening of caps and placed in hazmat bag.

item.title: Report X-2023090256
item.description:
Report X-2023090256

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T18:15:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: SPARTANBURG
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023090256 SequenceEvent: UNMARKED HAZMAT WENT THROUGH SORTER. HAZMAT CERTIFIED-ADMIN FOUND UNPROCESSED HAZMAT VISION LABEL ON PACKAGE AND NOTICED LEAK IN CORNER OF PACKAGE. DescribePack: PINHOLE CRACK IN BOTTOM OF CAN DUE TO DENT IN CAN. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: HAZMAT-CERTIFIED ADMIN USING PROPER PPE PLACED THE PACKAGE INSIDE A LINED HAZMAT TOTE AND SECURED THE TOTE INSIDE THE HAZMAT CAGE. 2. X-2023090377 NO COMMENTS PROVIDED.
